```{r, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(message=F, warning=F)
# prevent floating
knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.pos = "H", out.extra = "")
options(knitr.kable.NA = '')

library(glue)
library(tidyverse)
library(magrittr)
library(kableExtra)

# Displays the macOS CMD button symbol (as a keyboard button)
macOSCmdButton <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("\\keys{\\cmd}") }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output("<span class='key'>&#8984;</span>") }
  }

# Displays a label as a keyboard button
keyboardButton <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(paste0("\\keys{", label, "}")) }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(glue("<span class='key'>{label}</span>")) }
  }

# Converts Markdown text to LaTeX (or leaves it as-is for HTML builds)
# or use in a kable.
# Supports bold, italic, inline code, and newlines.
markdownForKable <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
               # convert markdown bold tags
    label %<>% stringr::str_replace_all("\\*\\*([\\w ()-]{1,})\\*\\*",
                                        "\\\\\\\\textbf{\\1}") %>%
               # italics
               stringr::str_replace_all("\\*([\\w ()-]{1,})\\*",
                                        "\\\\\\\\textit{\\1}") %>%
               # inline code
               stringr::str_replace_all("`([\\w ()-]{1,})`",
                                        "\\\\\\\\texttt{\\1}") %>%
               # newlines
               stringr::str_replace_all("\n", "\\\\\\\\newline ")
    knitr::asis_output(label)
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    { knitr::asis_output(label) }
  }
```

This book is a guide to using the software product **Readability Studio**, as well as a reference for readability formulas. For those interested in the formulas, please refer to the [English](#english-readability-tests), [Spanish](#spanish-readability-tests), and [German](#german-readability-tests) formula overviews. For further reading, refer to the [bibliography](#bibliography) for a concise list of articles discussing these formulas.
